page.title: 16ST JAMES' CHURCH - HUTTON
page.content: 123 adults live in the present ecclesiastical parish of Hutton, and the majority would cliam to be Anglicans. 40 people took communion on Easter Day, 1984, and 32 on Easter Day, 1985. The present Rector is the Rev. R. Frank, who is also incumbent of Skelton and Ivegill. The churchwardens are Lord Inglewood and Mr J. Slater of Thomas Close. One service is held each Sunday - 2 Sundays being Holy Communion from the Alternative Service Book, and 2 Sundays being Morning or Evening Prayer from the Book of Common Prayer. On a 5th Sunday, the service is Holy Communion from the B.C.P. Hymns Ancient and Modern (revised), and the Cathedral Psalter are used, and lessons are read from the Authorized Version of the Bible.
